properties.areaDesc: South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 1 at 10:29PM MST until January 2 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW AND WIND CONTINUING IN THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS...

.Snowfall will continue overnight in the northern mountains
before tapering off Thursday morning. Gusty winds of 35 to 50 mph
can also be expected on mountain passes, with even higher winds
in backcountry areas. The winds will produce blowing and drifting
snow with reduced visibilities. The heaviest snow totals can be
expected in the mountains north of Rabbit Ears Pass, with moderate
accumulations elsewhere in the northern Colorado mountains.

* WHAT...Snow with additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph.

* WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range,
and the Indian Peaks and Rocky Mountain National Park and the
Medicine Bow Range.

* WHEN...Until noon MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially this
evening. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or
visiting www.cotrip.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY
